publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msContents.summary:
I) Dǝrsānāt, Homiliary (fols. 2r-165vb) I-1) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Nativity of Jesus (fols. 2ra-7ra) I-2) Homily by Theophilus of Constantinople on St Stephen the Protomartyr (fols. 7ra-10va, fol. 13) I-3) Homily [by John Chrysostom] on Passion of Our Lord (fols. 10va-12v, 14ra-va) I-4) Homily by Ephrem on fasting, repentance and prayer (fols. 14va-15ra), possibly incomplete I-5) Homily by anonymous author (“one of the holy fathers”) on the man who was born blind (fols. 15ra-22ra), incomplete I-6) Homily by Ephrem on Passion of Our Lord and on the thief on the right hand (fols. 22ra-25vb) I-7) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the angel and the thief (fols. 25vb-32ra) I-8) Homily by Ephrem on Palm Sunday (i) (fols. 32ra-35rb) I-9) Homily by Ephrem on Palm Sunday (ii) (fols. 35rb- 39va) I-10) Homily by John Chrysostom on Palm Sunday (fols. 39va-43vb) I-11) Homily by Ephrem on Satan and death (fols. 44ra-51rb) I-12) Homily by Anǝsṭasyo [sic] of Dabra Sina on the burial of Our Lord (fols. 51rb-64rb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 19), possibly incomplete I-13) Homily by the Orthodox on the holy spiritual Easter (fols. 65va-69vb) I-14) Homily by John Chrysostom on Easter Sunday (fols. 69vb-73va) I-15) Homily by John Theologus (Tewologos) on Easter Sunday (fols. 73va-81vb) (cp. Orient. 774, no. 22) I-16) Homily by Jacob of Serug on the Apostle Thomas (fols. 82ra-87ra) I-17) Homily by John Chrysostom on Lazarus (fols. 87ra-89va) I-18) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Samaritan woman (fols. 89va-91vb) I-19) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Baptism of Our Lord (i) (fol. 92ra-94va) I-20) Homily by John Chrysostom on the wedding feast at Cana (fols. 94va-98va) I-21) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Baptism of Our Lord (ii) (fols. 98ra-100va) I-22) Homily by John Chrysostom on the sinful women who anointed the feet of Our Lord with ointment (fols. 100va-111ra) I-23) Homily by Jacob of Serug on Simeon the priest who received Jesus in the temple (fols. 111ra-117rb) I-24) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Pharisee and the publican (fols. 117rb-120vb) I-25) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Apostle Thomas (fols. 121ra-124ra) I-26) Homily by John Chrysostom on the Ten Virgins (fols. 124ra-130rb) I-27) Homily by Anǝsṭasyos of Dabra Sina on the Transfiguration (fols. 130rb-135vb) I-28) Homily by Jacob [of Serug] on the Annunciation to Zacharias of the birth of John the Baptist (fols. 135vb-138ra) I-29) Homily [by John Chrysostom] on repentance (fols. 138ra-143rb) I-30) The Story of John of Rome who acquired the “Golden Gospel” (fols. 143rb-165vb)
Additiones 1-5.

msItem.note: The collection of homilies contained in the Ms. is similar to that in Mss. Orient 744 (WrBriMus no. cccxl), Tanasee 131 = Daga Estifanos 20 (SixTana III, 126-32), Orient. 3075 (HamSixBerl n161,296-301). The sequence of the homilies is different.

supportDesc.foliation: One leaf between 148 and 149 is not numbered; the image has been given number 148a

list.item: 9 I(9; s.l.: {1}, no stub; 3, no stub; 5, no stub; fols. 1r-7v)

12
XIV(12/ fols. 138r-148v).
The structure of the quires is hardly discernible because of the condition of the Ms.

supportDesc.condition: The Ms. has been rebound; the threads of the sewing are broken; the original sewing is missing. The original order of the fols. is disturbed; the parts of the manuscript were probably put together in wrong order (perhaps as the result of repair). 126 should be between 144 and 145. Many fols. are held together by stitch repairs, someitimes so tightly that the structure of the quires cannot be discerned.

layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are partly visible.
Ruling pricks are partly visible (partly round, mostly slits).
The upper line is written below the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote: Fine, careful Black; redThe same scribe wrote Mss. MY-001 and MY-008.Late 14th - 15th century square script Incipits of the homilies (a few lines until Text I-4, and occasionally thereafter, e.g., Text I-22; otherwise mostly three rubricated lines alterating with black lines); notes in the upper margin of the fols. indicating occasions for the reading; elements of the punctuation signs, throughout until Text I-4, and with interruptions thereafter; elements of the text dividers thereafter throughout the Ms.
Number 6 looks like "compressed" number 7 (s. 22ra, in the upper margin).
Numbers are writen without the dashes above and below: s. 22ra, 44ra, 100vb, 111ra, 138ra etc.

item.quote: 2r: ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ማእጾ፡ ዘሰረቆ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ለይኩን፡
item.note: Written in the hand of the 17th-cent. Zabana Krǝstos (cp. Ms. MY-008).

item.quote: 147ra: አንፍጽ ። ለሙሴ፡ ነቢይ፡ በበሕር፡ ረደኢሁ፡ ይእዜኒ፡ ርድአነ፡ ከማሁ። በ፫ዘወርቅ፡ ለህም። ስብኮ፡ አመ፡ ገብረ፡ አሮን፡ ዘምሐኮ፡ መኀበርነ፡ ዮምባርኮ። በ፫መድኀኔ፡ ሕዝብ፡ በግብጽ፡ እምግብረ፡ ግንፋል፡ እምነደእት፡ ሶበ፡ ግዕሩ፡ እስረኤል፡ ምህለነ፡ ፈደ፫በሣህል። በ፫አመሐሙ፡ ሕዝብ፡ ሰአልዶ፡ ብርዕ፡ ግንፋለ፡ ወጥብዓተ፡ በገቢር፡ መድኀኒሆሙ፡ ኀብአነ፡ እምነከር። በ፫በቀለ፡ መጥቅዕ፡ ሰማዐ፡ መዋኢ፡ ለኢያሱ። ምህለነ፡ ዘይም፡ ኣንሶሰው።። [47rb] ፫ለናአድ፡ መሰፍን፡ ረደኢሁ፡ አመ፡ ኤግሎም፡ ምህለነ፡ ቀድሰ፡ ዘዮም። በ፫በረቦራ፡ ሕብር፡ ውእቱ፡ አመ፡ ሲሰራ፡ ረዲኢሃ፡ ለበ[ያ]፡ ምህለነ፡ ዘዮም፡ ሰመራ፨ በ፫ለጌድዮን፡ ጸባኢ፡ በቃለ፡ ቀርን፡ ኣድኀነነ፡ ይእዜ፡ እምዕልዋን፡ በ፫፳አህጉር ፡ ጸበኤ ።
item.note: Written in an old hand, but different from that of the main text, with many mistakes or orthographical deviations, hardly understandable. The beginning is missing, the end has been washed out.

list.item:
f. 147v : Malkǝʾa Māryām "Image of Mary", incomplete.
147v: ሰላም፡ ለኪ፡ መንበረ፡ {ጽሐይ}፡ ሰማይ፡ ዘከዋክብት፡...
ChRep 196, n92 .

item.desc: : Short record concerning tributes for Dabra Maʿṣo Yoḥannǝs.
item.note: Written in an old, very crude hand, hardly understandable. Some words have been washed out.

item.quote: 148v: በአኰቴተ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ዘወሀብኩ፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ አነ፡ ዓቀቤ፡ ሰዐት፡ ተሰብከ፡ መድኅን፡ ለደብረ፡ ማዕጾ፡ ለዮሐንስ፡ ዘወሃብኩ፡ አፈወርቅ፡ ወጳው[ሎ]ስ፡ ወማዐጠንት፡ ወወሱተይ። ሶበ፡ ተለቀሕኩ፡ ግምዛሁ፡ ለዮሓንስ፡ ፉሎተ፡ ብእሲትየ፡ ዘፈደይኩ፡ አነ፡ ተሰብከ፡ መድኅን፡ ነሥየ፡ እዘ፡ ዐቃቤ፡ ሰዓት፡ ወሥዩምሂ፡ አቡሁ፡ ሀሎ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ወበዓልቴቱሂ፡ አስምዑ፡ ወንጉሥሂ፡ ዳዊት፡ ወልደ፡ ሴፋርዓድ፡ ወመኰንንሂ፡ አሮኒምስ፡ ወማእከል፡ በሕርሂ፡ ዘአማኑኤል፡ ዘሄደ፡ ወዘተአገለ፡ ዘሤጠ፡ ወዘ፡ ተሠየጠ፡ ዘለቀሐ፡ ወዘተለቀሐ፡ ለዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡ እመሂ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ወእመሂ፡ ሥዩም፡ ወእመሂ፡ ዘኮነ፡ ከዊኖ፡ በአፈ፡ ዐሠርቱ፡ ወኀምስቱ፡ ነቢያት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ዓሠርቱ፡ ወክልኤቱ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ሰብዓ፡ ወክልኤቱ፡ አርድእት፡ ወበአፈ፡ ሠለስቱ፡ ምእት፡ ዓሠርቱ፡ ወሰማንቱ፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ በአፈ፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ወበአፉሀ፡ ለእግዚእትነ፡ ማርያም፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ወለእመ፡ ቦዘሐከከ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ይኩን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን።

148v: In praise of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit. The one who donated this book is I, ʿaqabe säʿat Täsäbkä Madḫǝn. To Yoḥannǝs, to Dabra Maʿṣo what I donated is Chrisostomos and Paul (?) and censers and wäsutäy. When I borrowed the treasures (gǝmza) of Yoḥannǝs, I paid back with falot (?) of my wife, having taken (it), while I, Täsäbkä Madḫǝn, am the ʿaqabe säʿat; and the śǝyyum is his father Hallo ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, and his wife is ʾAsmǝʿu, and the king is Dāwit a son of Sefarʿad, and mäkʷännǝn is ʾAron, and maʾkäl baḥr is Za-ʾAmanuʾel. Anyone who plundered and robbed, who sold and bought, who lent and who borrowed this book shall be cursed, be it a priest or a śǝyyum, be it who it may be, by the mouth of fifteen prophets and by the mouth of twelve apostles and by the mouth of seventy two disciples and by the mouth of three hundred eighteen Orthodox (fathers), by the mouth of Father and Son and Holy Spirit and by the mouth of our Lady Mary shall be cursed, and if someone scrapes (it), shall be cursed for ever and ever. Amen.

list.item: - 1r-v: Luke 6:36-7:7, a fragment of an old (pre-1350) Four Gospels manuscript. - Crude writing excercises (?): 2v-3r, 24r - Very crude writing exercises or pen trials, in old hands: 142v, 146v: ወጥን፡ በሰናይ፡ ፈጽም፡ በጽድ[ቅ]; 149r (in red ink). - Crude writing exercise and attempt at drawing an ornamental band: 149v.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards. Two sewing stations.
Most of the quires are reinforced by parchment guards.

origin.origDate: According to Additio 6, the Ms. was donated in the time of King Dāwit II (r. ca. 1382-1412), mäkʷännǝn Aron, and maʾkäl baḥr Za-ʾAmanuʾel. f. 1 originates from an older (pre-1350?) Four Gospels book.

listBibl.bibl: - D.Nosnitsin, “The Manuscript Collection of Dabra Ma‘so Qeddus Yohannes (Tigray, Ethiopia): a First Assessment”, Comparative Oriental Manuscript Studies Newsletter No. 1, January 2011, 24-27. - D. Nosnitsin - M. Bulakh, "A Fragment of an Ancient Four Gospels Book (Lk 6:35–7:7): A Short Analysis", in: A. Bausi - A. Gori - G. Lusini (eds.), Linguistic, Oriental and Ethiopian Studies in Memory of Paolo Marrassini, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz 2014, 551-581. - M. Bulakh, "Ancient Ge'ez Orthography: Evaluation of the Fragment of Luke (Verses 6:37–6:43) in the Manuscript MY-002 from Dabra Ma'so, Tegray", in: A. Bausi - A. Gori - G. Lusini (eds.), Linguistic, Oriental and Ethiopian Studies in Memory of Paolo Marrassini, Wiesbaden: Harrassowitz 2014, 177-212.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 6, the book was donated by ʿaqabe säʿat Täsäbkä Madḫǝn, in the time of King Dāwit II (r. ca. 1382-1412). His father is Hallo ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer, and his mother is ʾAsmǝʿu.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
